title: Internet works fine outside of league
body: I can browse the internet fine, facebook, email, netflix, pandora. Once I finally get through log in screen -sometimes gives me the error there- I get disconnected and cant navigate the launcher, nor will anything load like my mastery with champions. I played just fine on 12-26-16, and have not changed any of my settings. So I'm unsure even to where to start.

replies.body:
Different servers and services (the sites you listed) reside in different geolocations, therefore you may encounter routing issues to one server, but not another. Before we take a close look at your network routing, we'll first need to ensure your local settings are not incompatible with League, so I encourage you to work through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Let me know if this fixed your issue or not.

Just got done reinstalling league, and did the direct porting and firewall allowing. Still nothing, I don't receive any notification from my PC saying something is being blocked or anything. Just an instant disconnect when the game loads.

Since you mentioned some packet loss from a network test during your troubleshooting, I'd like us to take a closer look at your route. I'd like you to use a network testing app called [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to complete this. After loading up the app, plug **104.160.131.1** into the host field before starting the trace. After 5 minutes has gone by, export your results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

If you ran into any issues with that, let me know.

Thanks for providing these traceroute results! They show that your issue starts on your home network at 2% packet loss and a latency spike of 277ms. Your network routing then sees a huge spike in packet loss at 77% on the **76.213.0.40** hop and a peak latency of 1556ms along your entire route. These are indicative of problems along your route and I'd suggest reaching out to a tier 2 agent or supervisor at your ISP with this traceroute so they can launch an investigation.

Let me know if you have any questions.
I checked my network logs, and it is apparent that I am losing packets, downloading the Hextech Repair tool now to see if it will shine light.

Try reinstalling it again or switching between the alpha to old client
if that doesn't work check your Internet setting sometimes a virus can override things and block the connection
